line_1: When young she was handsome, they envy'd me sair,
line_2: But now when she's auld they may envy me mair!

line_1: Or if perchance some friend or lady sair
line_2: Should draw him forth to taste the noontide air,

line_1: My een they grew red and my heart it grew sair;
line_2: I own, when I thought I should see him nae mair,

line_1: Good men are chang'd frae wooers sair,
line_2: A wife becomes a drudge o' care,
